DOCNAME: BRÁS DE MATOS AND DA COSTA TORREZÃO v. PORTUGAL
JUDGES: András Sajó;Egidijus Kūris;Guido Raimondi;Nebojša Vučinić;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant in the first case , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant in the second case , PERSON Costa Torrezão , is a NORP national , who was born on DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant gave birth to C. in GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date , ORG ( PERSON – CPCYP ) of PERSON reported the applicant ’s family situation to ORG at ORG . Proceedings for the protection of children and young persons ( processo de promoção e protecção de crianças e jovens em risco ) were initiated and the prosecutor ordered that C. was not to leave the hospital .

CARDINAL . On DATE , C. was provisionally placed in a foster home QUANTITY away from the applicant ’s home . The admission into foster care was decided on the grounds that the applicant was living in substandard housing , without furniture , that she was suffering from a mild psychological and emotional condition and that she was unemployed . The decision was also based on the fact that the applicant ’s partner , who was the father of the child , was alcoholic and had displayed violent behaviour towards the applicant .
CARDINAL . On an unknown date , the applicant moved to a new apartment in GPE and left her partner .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the prosecutor confirmed the placement of C. in foster care for DATE and the applicant agreed to see a psychiatrist on a regular basis .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the applicant , who was then suffering from depression owing to the separation from her child , was admitted to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the placement of C. in foster care was extended for DATE and the applicant renewed her promise to see a psychiatrist and promised to find a job , as well as better housing .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the prosecutor confirmed the placement of C. pending review of the interim protection order as provided for by law .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , who was granted legal aid , opposed the extension of the measure and the case was brought before ORG . The prosecutor requested that the child be placed in foster care with a view to her adoption ; the applicant requested that she be returned to her .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG ordered the final placement of C. , then DATE , in foster care with a view to her adoption . Relying , in particular , on the statements from the social services in PERSON and from the foster home ’s staff , the court considered that the applicant was not in a position to change her situation and fulfil her parental duties . As no other family member was available to take care of the child , the court considered that the placement in foster care , with a view to adoption , would be in the best interests of the child .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the decision before ORG ( Tribunal da Relação de Évora ) , which , on DATE , dismissed the appeal and upheld the decision of the firstinstance court .
CARDINAL . There was no subsequent appeal before ORG ( Supremo Tribunal de Justiça ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the ORG was informed that the applicant was living in poor conditions and about to give birth . The applicant and her partner were both HIV - positive . The former had an unstable professional and personal life and had previously suffered the loss of a child in circumstances which remained unclear . The latter had a long history of drug addiction .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant gave birth to GPE in GPE .
CARDINAL . The child was immediately admitted to the paediatric service of the hospital and then placed in foster care following an interim protection order issued on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date , the case was brought before the ORG ( Tribunal de Família e Menores de Setúbal ) , which held a hearing on DATE . The applicant alleged that she had not been informed of the hearing and had therefore not been heard by the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the ORG ordered the placement of the child in foster care with a view to his adoption .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant ’s newly appointed lawyer challenged that decision before ORG , which , on DATE , upheld the first - instance decision .

CARDINAL . Despite the applicant ’s wish , the appointed lawyer did not bring the case before ORG , considering that an appeal against a decision based on “ suitability and appropriateness ” ( conveniência ou oportunidade ) would be barred by Article DATE , paragraph CARDINAL , of LAW .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date , the applicant wrote a letter to ORG , which replied , on DATE , that it could only hear formal appeals against decisions of lower jurisdictions lodged in compliance with the applicable rules .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant lodged an administrative request with ORG . The request was closed on DATE and a similar request was again closed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was informed that the case was being transferred to ORG do PERSON ) . The reasons for this transfer are unknown .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was notified that ORG would discontinue the proceedings as the case had already been settled by ORG .

CARDINAL . The relevant legislation relating to interim protection orders is described in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE and Pontes v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .

In particular , LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE on proceedings for the promotion of rights and protection of children and young persons in danger ( processo de promoção de direitos e protecção das CARDINAL e jovens em risco ) , as amended by PERSON no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , reads as follows :
“ Proceedings for the protection of children and young persons in danger ... are based on voluntary jurisdiction [ ORG voluntária ] . ”
CARDINAL . Article DATE , paragraph CARDINAL , of LAW reads as follows :
DATE adopted on grounds of suitability or appropriateness [ conveniência ou oportunidade ] shall not be subject to appeal before ORG .

CARDINAL . The relevant case - law of ORG shows a general trend towards recognition of ORG jurisdiction to hear appeals relating to the protection of children and young persons as long as the appeals raise issues of law and do not question the “ suitability or appropriateness ” of the lower court ’s decisions , which are matters of fact . The following are some excerpts from relevant decisions :

“ ... The intervention of ORG in the judgment of appeals is limited to an assessment of the decisions taken in accordance with strict legality . CARDINAL . It can verify compliance with requirements , procedural or substantive , the power to choose the most convenient measure to protect the interests at stake and the compliance with the purpose for which such powers were allocated to the courts , but not the suitability or appropriateness of that choice . ” ( DATE )

“ ... However , this limitation does not imply that the intervention of ORG should be totally excluded with regard to this type of appeal ; it merely restricts it to an assessment of the appealed decisions as far as the strict application of the law is concerned . In particular , [ it restricts ORG assessment ] to the procedural and substantive grounds on which the power to adopt the relevant measure ... is exercised ” ( DATE ) .

“ As proceedings for the promotion and protection of children and young persons at risk are qualified as voluntary jurisdiction proceedings , ... its [ ORG ] intervention can only be limited to verifying the procedural and substantive assumptions legally established for the application of the measure that has been determined by the lower court and its adequacy for the purpose to which the criteria of suitability and appropriateness must be subordinated . ” ( DATE )

“ ... However , this legal provision must be carefully interpreted as , frequently , the appeals do not only relate to lower courts’ decisions based on suitability or appropriateness but also to the enforceability of the legal requirements or other requirements on which the decisions are based , namely their compliance with constitutional or supranational norms , which are subject to the scrutiny of ORG . ” ( DATE ) .

“ Granting custody [ of the child ] to the person selected for adoption or to an institution with a view to future adoption triggers a severance in any existing relation with the biological family of the child . ... Such a measure is based on the general assumption that there is no affective parent - child relationship , or that any such relationship is severely impaired , and can only be decided in the situations described [ DATE , paragraph CARDINAL , of LAW ] where verification is subject , on appeal , to ORG scrutiny . ” ( DATE ) .
